comments.author: thenerdlygentleman
comments.body: Try looking for a job in a pub. You normally only find english speaking ppl there.

comments.author: maronimaedchen
comments.body: definitely doable ! a few of the cafés I frequent have english speaking baristas. you should however be able to understand an order in german. oh and btw, r/vienna isn't very active, the locals use r/wien just in case you have any more questions :)

comments.author: youremymymymylover
comments.body:
Are you an EU citizen?

Try delivery jobs, warehouse work, dish cleaning, hostels, hotels, concert venues, private tutoring

comments.author: Ryan17co
comments.body: Any suggestions for non-eu / full time ?

comments.author: youremymymymylover
comments.body:
Study in an Austrian university and specialize in a Mangelfach. 

Show international companies with research departments that you would be valuable to their team.

Embassy

Copywriting

comments.author: Ryan17co
comments.body: I’m actually asking for a family friend who just finished her master in Austria- but is non-eu and it seems to be quite a challenge to get a company willing to arrange a visa. I’ll pass on your advice, thanks!
